cards.flavor: Legends tell of a time when the Storm-Serpent, a being as old as Svergard itself, shall rise once more and devour the plane whole.
cards.name: Algrond, Storm-Serpent
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Algrond can't be blocked except by Gods.
Whenever Algrond attacks, you may put target nonland, non-God permanent on top of its owner's library.

cards.flavor: (As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)
cards.name: Algrond's Awakening
cards.text:
(As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)
I, II — Return target permanent an opponent controls to its owner's hand.
III — Search your library for a Kraken, Leviathan, Octopus, or Serpent card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.name: Amos, Rune-Mage
cards.text:
Whenever you scry, put a loyalty counter on Amos, Rune-Mage.
[+1]: Create a Glyph token. (It's an artifact with “{1}, Sacrifice this Scry 1.”)
[-1]: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
[-5]: Draw three cards.

Enchant creature

cards.flavor: Some fight not for glory, but for profit.
cards.name: Bandit Brigade

cards.flavor: In place of execution, the most forgettable criminals are banished; destitute, nameless, and never to return.

cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller creates a tapped colorless land token named Far-Off Lands with “{T}: Add one mana of any color.”

cards.flavor: Maldunn's couriers take after the god himself; swift, wise, and always watching.

cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.flavor: Denizens of Svergard learn both fear and respect for the wind, for it can just as easily rip their sails apart as it can fill them.

cards.text: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. Create a Glyph token. (It's an artifact with “{1}, Sacrifice this: Scry 1.”)

cards.flavor: Angels of the Light-Maiden are charged with guiding the worthy to the Halls of Valor, where they train for the battle at the end of all worlds.

cards.flavor: “Come forth! Let my warcry be an anthem and my strikes your drums!”

cards.name: Ceaseless Assault
cards.text: Untap all creatures. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

cards.flavor: To a dwarf, an army is just a family with more members and less infighting.

[-7]: Creatures you control gain vigilance until end of turn. After this phase, there are three additional combat phases followed by an additional main phase.

cards.flavor: Confronting a dire wolf is a true test of courage. They say only way to kill one is to put a blade between its jaws.
cards.name: Challenge the Monstrous
cards.text: Destroy target creature if it's tapped or has power 4 or greater.

cards.flavor: Any poet can decipher inscribed tales of the past, but only a rare few can divine the future from stone.

III — Creatures you control with power 4 or greater get +1/+1 and gain vigilance until end of turn.
​

cards.flavor: Reinforcements came — but not in time.
cards.name: Overwhelmed Sentry

Vigilance

cards.text:
Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

cards.text:
(As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)

cards.flavor:

cards.text:

I — Destroy all other creatures and enchantments.

cards.name: Realm Nexus
cards.text:

cards.flavor: Some elves see themselves as the hands of nature itself, maintaining the “correct order” of the world.

cards.flavor: Many tales are told about hunters in pursuit of such creatures, but few of their successes.
